metadata.title: Tokyo Travel Japanese
metadata.description: Learning basic Japanese for an immersive experience in the vibrant city of Tokyo!

curriculum.lesson_topic: Tokyo Travel Japanese: Learning basic Japanese for an immersive experience in the vibrant city of Tokyo!

sub_topics.description: Learn essential greetings and self-introduction phrases to start conversations politely in Tokyo.
Master how to ask for and understand directions to navigate Tokyo's complex streets and transportation systems.

sub_topics.sub_topic: Ordering Food and Drinks at Restaurants
sub_topics.description: Learn how to confidently order meals and drinks at various eateries, from traditional ramen shops to modern cafes.
Acquire the language skills necessary for shopping, including asking about prices and making purchases in yen.
Learn how to check into a hotel, ask for amenities, and handle basic communication related to your accommodation.

flashcards.example: 東京で、こんにちはと言うのは一般的です。 (Tōkyō de, konnichiwa to iu no wa ippanteki desu.) - In Tokyo, saying 'Konnichiwa' is common.
親切な人にありがとうと言いましょう。 (Shinsetsu na hito ni arigatō to iimashō.) - Let's say thank you to kind people.
すみません、道を聞いてもいいですか？ (Sumimasen, michi o kiite mo ii desu ka?) - Excuse me, can I ask for directions?
はい、東京タワーに行ったことがあります。 (Hai, Tōkyō tawā ni itta koto ga arimasu.) - Yes, I have been to Tokyo Tower.
いいえ、日本語はまだ上手ではありません。 (Iie, Nihongo wa mada jōzu dewa arimasen.) - No, I am not very good at Japanese yet.
東京駅はとても大きいです。 (Tōkyō eki wa totemo ōkii desu.) - Tokyo Station is very big.
トイレはどこですか？ (Toire wa doko desu ka?) - Where is the toilet?
ホテルは駅から近いです。 (Hoteru wa eki kara chikai desu.) - The hotel is near the station.
美味しいレストランを知っていますか？ (Oishii resutoran o shitte imasu ka?) - Do you know a good restaurant?
東京で観光を楽しんでいます。 (Tōkyō de kankō o tanoshinde imasu.) - I am enjoying sightseeing in Tokyo.

exercises.sentence: 東京の地下鉄で切符を___時、どこに行きたいかを確認します。
exercises.explanation: The correct verb is "買う" (kau - to buy), as you need to buy a ticket when using the Tokyo subway. "食べる" (taberu - to eat), "見る" (miru - to see), and "飲む" (nomu - to drink) do not fit the context of purchasing a ticket.

exercises.sentence: 渋谷の交差点はとても___ので、初めての人は驚くかもしれません。
exercises.explanation: "混んでいる" (kondeiru - crowded) accurately describes Shibuya crossing. "静か" (shizuka - quiet), "広い" (hiroi - wide), and "近い" (chikai - near) are not characteristics of this famous intersection.

exercises.sentence: 浅草寺で___を引いて、今日の運勢を試してみましょう。
exercises.explanation: "おみくじ" (omikuji - fortune slip) is drawn at temples like Senso-ji. "お弁当" (obento - boxed lunch), "お土産" (omiyage - souvenir), and "お茶" (ocha - tea) do not fit this action.

exercises.sentence: 新宿御苑は___庭園で、四季折々の美しい景色が楽しめます。
exercises.explanation: "広い" (hiroi - spacious) correctly describes Shinjuku Gyoen. "高い" (takai - tall/expensive), "新しい" (atarashii - new), and "古い" (furui - old) are not appropriate descriptions of the garden's overall characteristic.

exercises.sentence: 原宿で___服を買うのが好きです。特にユニークなデザインのものが好きです。
exercises.explanation: "面白い" (omoshiroi - interesting/unique) fits the context of unique designs in Harajuku. "高い" (takai - expensive), "小さい" (chiisai - small), and "重い" (omoi - heavy) do not relate to design qualities.

simulation.title: Lost in Translation, Found in Tokyo
simulation.setting: Akari, a first-time visitor to Tokyo, gets separated from her tour group near Shibuya Crossing. Overwhelmed but determined, she attempts to navigate using her phrasebook and a dash of courage.

content.speaker: Narrator
content.target_language_text: 秋葉原で、明はグループから離れてしまいました。
content.phonetics: Akihabara de, Akari wa guruupu kara hanarete shimaimashita.
content.base_language_translation: In Akihabara, Akari got separated from her group.

content.speaker: Akari
content.target_language_text: すみません、駅はどこですか？
content.phonetics: Sumimasen, eki wa doko desu ka?
content.base_language_translation: Excuse me, where is the station?

content.speaker: Old Man
content.base_language_translation: The station? Ah, it's over there.

content.speaker: Akari
content.target_language_text: ありがとうございます！

content.speaker: Akari
content.target_language_text: 渋谷までお願いします。

content.speaker: Narrator
content.target_language_text: 明は東京で新しい冒険を始めます。
content.phonetics: Akari wa Tokyo de atarashii bouken o hajimemasu.
content.base_language_translation: Akari starts a new adventure in Tokyo.
